title: Improve indexing type error message
body_html:
Example:

>>> torch.randn(3,3)[(1,torch.LongTensor([2]))]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: indexing a tensor with an object of type torch.LongTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars and torch.LongTensor or torch.ByteTensor as the only argument.

This error message is difficult to parse. I think there are two main issues:

  1. The type of the indexing object is reported as torch.LongTensor, but it's a tuple including a torch.LongTensor (this makes "the only argument" later confusing -- torch.LongTensor was reported as the only argument).

  2. It's not clear what "as the only argument" binds to; should it be:
    a) and ( (torch.LongTensor or torch.ByteTensor) as the only argument.)
    b) and torch.LongTensor or ( torch.ByteTensor as the only argument).

TypeError: indexing a tensor with an object of type torch.LongTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars and torch.LongTensor or torch.ByteTensor as the only argument.

This error message is difficult to parse.  I think there are two main issues:


The type of the indexing object is reported as torch.LongTensor, but it's a tuple including a torch.LongTensor (this makes "the only argument" later confusing -- torch.LongTensor was reported as the only argument).


It's not clear what "as the only argument" binds to; should it be:
a) and ( (torch.LongTensor or torch.ByteTensor) as the only argument.)
b) and torch.LongTensor or ( torch.ByteTensor as the only argument).
body:
Example:
```
>>> torch.randn(3,3)[(1,torch.LongTensor([2]))]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: indexing a tensor with an object of type torch.LongTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars and torch.LongTensor or torch.ByteTensor as the only argument.
```

This error message is difficult to parse.  I think there are two main issues:
1) The type of the indexing object is reported as torch.LongTensor, but it's a tuple including a torch.LongTensor (this makes "the only argument" later confusing -- torch.LongTensor was reported as the only argument).

2) It's not clear what "as the only argument" binds to; should it be:
a) and ( (torch.LongTensor or torch.ByteTensor) as the only argument.) 
b) and torch.LongTensor or ( torch.ByteTensor as the only argument).
